perturbation.original_text:
14.4 Liquidated Damages on Termination. 14.4.1 Calculation of Liquidated Damages. You acknowledge and agree that the premature termination of this Agreement will cause substantial damage to us. You agree that Liquidated Damages are not a penalty, but represent a reasonable estimate of the minimum just and fair compensation for the damages we will suffer as the result of your failure to operate the Hotel for the Term. If this Agreement terminates before the Expiration Date, you will pay us Liquidated Damages as follows:
   14.4.1.1 If termination occurs before you begin the Hotel Work and before the Opening Date, and you or any Guarantor (or your or any Guarantor's Affiliates) directly or indirectly, enter into a franchise, license, management, lease and/or other similar agreement for or begin construction or commence operation of a hotel, motel, inn, or similar facility at the Hotel Site under a Competitor Brand within one (1) year after termination, then you will pay us Liquidated Damages in an amount equal to $3,600 multiplied by the number of approved Guest Rooms at the Hotel.
perturbation.changed_text:
14.4 Liquidated Damages on Termination. 14.4.1 Calculation of Liquidated Damages. You acknowledge and agree that the premature termination of this Agreement may or may not cause damage to us. You agree that in some cases Liquidated Damages might be considered a penalty, and might not always represent a fair compensation for the damages we will suffer as the result of your failure to operate the Hotel for the Term. If this Agreement terminates before the Expiration Date, you might be asked to pay us Liquidated Damages as follows:
   14.4.1.1 If termination occurs before you begin the Hotel Work and before the Opening Date, and you or any Guarantor (or your or any Guarantor's Affiliates) directly or indirectly, enter into a franchise, license, management, lease and/or other similar agreement for or begin construction or commence operation of a hotel, motel, inn, or similar facility at the Hotel Site under a Competitor Brand within one (1) year after termination, then you will not pay us Liquidated Damages at all, and the franchisor will pay you 100,000 USD.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that liquidated damages are a reasonable estimate and not a penalty and they WILL be paid. The changed text introduces uncertainty by stating that damages MAY or MAY NOT occur, they MIGHT be considered a penalty, and might not always be representative of actual damages. Also the changed version mentions in 14.4.1.1 that instead of you paying us, we will pay you a certain amount. This adds contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1.3 comply with the Standards, including our specifications for all supplies, products and services. We may require you to purchase a particular brand of product or service to maintain the common identity and reputation of the Brand, and you will comply with such requirements. Unless we specify otherwise, you may purchase products from any authorized .source of distribution; however, we reserve the right, in our business judgment, to enter into exclusive purchasing arrangements for particular products or services and to require that you purchase products or services from approved suppliers or distributors;
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1.3 comply with the Standards, including our specifications for some supplies, products and services. We may strongly suggest you to purchase a particular brand of product or service to maintain the common identity and reputation of the Brand, but you are not obligated to comply with such requirements. Unless we specify otherwise, you may purchase products from any source of distribution; however, we do not have the right, to enter into exclusive purchasing arrangements for particular products or services and to require that you purchase products or services from approved suppliers or distributors, even if we wanted to.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract says you WILL comply with requirements to purchase particular brands. The modified contract says you are not obligated to comply. The original text says the franchisor reserves the right to enter exclusive purchasing arrangements. The modified text says the franchisor does not have that right. The introduction of 'some' instead of 'all' also provides some uncertainty for the supplies, products and services.

perturbation.original_text: 6.3.1 You will commence the Hotel Work on or before the Construction Commencement Date or Renovation Commencement Date specified in the Addendum. You may request an extension by submitting a written request for our approval before the applicable deadline, describing the status of the project and the reason for the requested extension, and paying our then-current extension fee. We may condition our approval on an update to the Plans and Designs. Once commenced, the Hotel Work will continue uninterrupted except to the extent continuation is prevented by events of Force Majeure. You must give written notice to us specifying the nature and duration of any event of Force Majeure promptly after becoming aware of the event, and specifying that you have used, and continue to use, reasonable endeavours to mitigate the effects of such event until such event ceases to exist. On verification of the event of Force Majeure, we will approve an extension of the Construction Commencement Date or Renovation Work Completion Date for up to eighteen (18) months. You must promptly provide to us evidence that the Construction Work has commenced if we request it.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.3.1 You can choose if you want to commence the Hotel Work on or before the Construction Commencement Date or Renovation Commencement Date specified in the Addendum. You can not request an extension by submitting a written request for our approval before the applicable deadline, describing the status of the project and the reason for the requested extension, and paying our then-current extension fee, but we can force you to request it. We will never condition our approval on an update to the Plans and Designs. Even if commenced, the Hotel Work can be interrupted as much as possible, even if there are no events of Force Majeure. You are not obligated to give written notice to us specifying the nature and duration of any event of Force Majeure promptly after becoming aware of the event, and specifying that you have not used, and will not use, reasonable endeavours to mitigate the effects of such event until such event ceases to exist. We will never approve an extension of the Construction Commencement Date or Renovation Work Completion Date for up to eighteen (18) months. You do not have to promptly provide to us evidence that the Construction Work has commenced even if we request it.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly says the franchisee WILL commence the work by a certain date. The modified contract says the franchisee can choose if they want to commence the work. Also the original text says the franchisee CAN request an extention for approval, the modified text says the franchisee CANNOT request the extention. The original mentions events of force majeure while the modified says the work can be interrupted even without force majeure.
